amendment.description: To strengthen Social Security and Medicare without raiding them to pay for new government programs, like Obamacare, that have failed Americans by increasing premiums and reducing affordable health care options, to reform Medicaid without prioritizing able-bodied adults over the disabled, and to ensure that any importation does not increase risk to public health according to the Secretary of Health and Human Services.

action.text: Amendment SA 174 ruled out of order by the chair.
Motion to waive all applicable budgetary discipline with respect to amendment SA 174 rejected in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 49 - 49. Record Vote Number: 19.
Point of order that the amendment violates section 305(b)(2) of the CBA raised in Senate with respect to amendment SA 174.
Amendment SA 174 proposed by Senator Alexander.
Roll call votes on amendments in Senate: Motion to waive all applicable budgetary discipline with respect to amendment SA 174 rejected in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 49 - 49. Record Vote Number: 19.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 174 proposed by Senator Alexander.
